4/ It makes a lot of sense that Monero users would be the first to embrace Bisq in a big way.  The two projects are well-aligned in their focus on privacy, and with the KYC walls closing in on so many centralized exchanges, Bisq is emerging as one of the few viable options left.

5/ Of course we hope that Monero adoption is just the tip of the spear.   Bisq’s core mission is to provide a secure, private on/off ramp between bitcoin and fiat currencies.  Just imagine where all this could go if any significant percentage of fiat users started using Bisq.
2/ Indeed, yesterday saw new ATH records for Bisq, both in overall volume (110 BTC) and number of trades (152), the vast majority of which was Monero trading.  https://t.co/7pWeLZ59Lk
